sagma.core.render
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  sagma.core.render.Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
Demo, FPS, Particle, RTS, TestAsset, Tutorial1, Tutorial2, Tutorial3, Tutorial4, Tutorial5, Tutorial6
public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object

Game serves as a template and action springboard for all game implementations usind the SAGMA engine.

Author:
Aaron Kison

setEscapeKeyToExit

public void setEscapeKeyToExit()

Binds the escape key to immediately quitting the application.

Applications that require save states should avoid this function or override the exit method.

exit

public void exit()

Immediately terminates the engine

Override to change the function of setEscapeKeyToExit

centreOfScreen

@Deprecated
public static Vec3 centreOfScreen()
Deprecated. 

May or may not be the centre of the screen.

For simple cases, it should be the centre.

make

public Instance make(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                     java.lang.String filename)

Makes a new model or sprite based upon the filename given.


If a supported model format (.obj) is found, then a model is created
If a supported sprite format (.jpg, .png, .gif, .bmp) is found, then a sprite is created

This method automatically packs the model or sprite into an Instance and adds the instance to the rendering engine.

If you do not want your objects auto-packed, for example you want to re-use a model, then you should use makeModel(drawable, filename)

Parameters:
drawable - The drawable context given
filename - Relative path and name of the file
Returns:
See Also:
Instance

public Instance make(java.lang.String filename)

setGameMode

public void setGameMode(int mode)

Sets the current game mode.

Valid options are:

  • GAMEMODE_2D
  • GAMEMODE_3D

The default is GAMEMODE_2D

Parameters:
mode -

add

public void add(CollisionListener listener)

Adds a new collision listener, usually in the form of a CollisionAction CollisionAction.

This event will fire when one applicable instance intersects another applicable instance

Instances can be made immune to collisions by setting their solidarity with {@link Instance#setSolid(boolean) setSolid(boolean)}

Parameters:
listener -
See Also:
Instance, CollisionAction

addCollisionListener

@Deprecated
public void addCollisionListener(CollisionListener listener)
Deprecated. 

Replaced with add(CollisionListener)

Parameters:
listener -

add

public void add(PickedObjectListener listener)

Adds a new picked object listener, usually in the form of a PickedObjectAction.

A picked object is an object triggered by a mouse or other input device clicking or otherwise selecting an applicable object in the scene.

By default all items are pickable, to render an object immune to picking the {@link Instance#setPickable(boolean) setPickable(boolean) method can be used.

Parameters:
listener -
See Also:
Instance, PickedObjectAction

addPickedObjectListener

public void addPickedObjectListener(PickedObjectListener listener)
Deprecated. 

Replaced with add(PickedObjectListener

directionFrom

public Game.Direction directionFrom(Vec3 v1,
                                    Vec3 v2)

Returns the direction from the first vector to the second.

Possible values are:

  • UP
  • DOWN
  • LEFT
  • RIGHT
  • FORWARD
  • BACK

Note: You will only see FORWARD and BACK directions when in GAMEMODE_3D

See Also:
setGameMode(int)

directionFrom

public Game.Direction directionFrom(Instance a,
                                    Instance toB)
Returns the direction from Instance A to Instance B

See Also:
directionFrom(Vec3, Vec3)

heartbeat

public void heartbeat()

The heartbeat is a consistant beat used by the rendering engine to keep everything synchronized. This method is a courtesy method designed to replace the function of the Timer.

Heartbeat will get called at the step-rate of the engine, which is about 24 times per second. This method can be freely overriden without any consequence.

moveCameraTo

public void moveCameraTo(Instance i)

Centres the camera on the location of a given instance.

Call this in a heartbeat to continually track the instance.

Parameters:
i -

generateMaskFor

public static void generateMaskFor(java.io.File file)

Attempts to generate a mask for a given picture file.

If the mask already exists then the action will depend on what WriteFlag is set.

Parameters:
file -
See Also:
setWriteFlag(WriteFlag)

setWriteFlag

public void setWriteFlag(Game.WriteFlag flag)

Sets the action to occur when a mask exists and another was created.

Possible values are:

  • OVERWRITE
  • SILENCE
  • DEBUG
  • WARNING

OVERWRITE flag will automatically write over the mask with the newly generated mask

SILENCE flag will not overwrite anything, and it wont say anything about the conflicts.

DEBUG flag will not overwrite and will inform you of all conflicts and all newly created masks

WARNING flag will not overwrite and will only inform you of conflicts

Parameters:
flag -

generateMasksForAll

public void generateMasksForAll(java.io.File folder)
Generates a mask for all applicable images inside the given folder.

See Also:
generateMaskFor(File)
